name: liver hemangioma
description: Liver hemangioma is characterized by benign growth of blood vessels in the liver, often discovered accidentally during abdominal imaging scans. It appears as a distinct bright spot on ultrasound and CT scans, and as a bright area on MRI.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: This indicates whether liver hemangioma is present.

values.name: absent
values.description: It signifies no liver hemangioma is present.

values.name: present
values.description: It suggests liver hemangioma is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: It suggests that it cannot be determined whether liver hemangioma is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It represents uncertainty regarding the presence of liver hemangioma.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: This indicates the anatomical region of the liver hemangioma.
